snippet: The Golan Heights, long Israel’s quietest frontier, is now one of its most unpredictable, and residents are training to handle the worst.
abstract: Residents of Golan Heights, Israel's quietest frontier for four decades, are on edge as fighting in Syria continues, especially in border villages; Hezbollah, Lebanese Shiite militia backing the Syrian Army and Islamic State group all consider Israel, which captured Golan from Syria in 1967, an illegal occupier of area.
lead_paragraph: The Golan Heights, long Israel’s quietest frontier, is now one of its most unpredictable, and residents are training to handle the worst.

headline.main: In Golan, Imagined Risks Become All Too Real
headline.print_headline: In Golan, Imagined Risks Become All Too Real

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
